title: Ocean ecosystems
summary: Ocean ecosystems are complex networks of living organisms and their physical environment in marine waters.

content.text: Ocean ecosystems are complex networks of living organisms and their physical environment in marine waters. They include a vast range of habitats from coastal wetlands to the deep sea, supporting incredible biodiversity.
Oceans contain the greatest diversity of life on Earth, with ecosystems ranging from coral reefs to deep-sea hydrothermal vents, each supporting unique communities of organisms.

references.text: Thurman, Harold V. (2016). Introductory Oceanography. Pearson.
